trans-unit.source: The period contains no evaluable days
Glucose values are from different sources

The creation of the PDFs can take an extremely long time. This is due to a flood of profile switches that are created by a plug-in for automation. This causes a profile switch every 4 minutes with storage of the complete profile. If the option is active, then these profile switches are sorted out and thus enable the creation of the PDF. These profile switches are then no longer visible in the PDFs.
The specified URL is not reachable. If the URL is correct, then it may be due to the Nightscout-settings.

If this URL is protected (AUTH_DEFAULT_ROLES is not set to "admin" or "readable"), the access key must also be defined correctly. This can be done via "Administrator Tools" on the personal Nightscout page.

More information about the AUTH_DEFAULT_ROLES is available here.

The ENABLE variable must contain the word "cors" so that external tools like this one can access the data. If the server also has the CORS_ALLOW_ORIGIN variable, you must ensure that either the current URL (@@) or @*@ is entered there.

On 10be, the default settings for the server must enable the "cors" checkbox so that external tools like this one can access the data. If "cors" has been activated, ReDeploy may have to be done on the server before it is really available.

The server variable ENABLE must contain the word "cors" so that external tools like this one can access the data.

If the server is in the Google Cloud, the settings must be made in an SSH terminal.
The Url to the Nightscout API must start with https, since Nightscout Reporter also runs on https. Access to unsafe http resources is not possible.

trans-unit.note: this is the timeformat - please use hh for 24-hours, HH for 12-hours, ap for am/pm, mm for minutes, ss for seconds
this is the short timeformat - please use hh for 24-hours, HH for 12-hours, ap for am/pm, mm for minutes
this is the dateformat, please use dd for days, MM for months and yyyy for year.
this is the dateformat, please use dd for days, MM for months and no year.

trans-unit.source: The green pentagon represents the value range of a healthy person without diabetes.
The yellow pentagon represents the value range of the specified period.
Yellow circles indicate that the corresponding value exceeds the scale.
Coefficient of Variability represents the variation of values around the glycaemic average value in percent.
The Prognostic Glycaemic Risk parameter represents the risk of long-term complications (not proven by studies up to now).
The time per day in minutes in which the values are outside the range {$PH} to {$PH_1}.
The intensity of hypoglycaemia per day (values less than or equal to {$PH}).
The intensity of hyperglycaemia per day (values greater than or equal to {$PH}).
The mean glycaemic value in specified period.

Nightscout Reporter can have statistical data about use of the site evaluated via Google Analytics. This helps me (the programmer) gain insight into how the site is being used and make decisions about further development and language support. This data sharing is completely voluntary and the functionality of the site is independent of the decision made here.
Do you agree that Google Analytics collects information about your use of the site?
There was no answer within seconds from

An error occurred while accessing the server. One possible reason is, that the server's certificate was not purchased. If you would like to have access to the server, you can do this by granting access permission on the server's website in the browser. Should the server's website be accessed so that you can grant authorization there?

Although you had given permission for Google Analytics, it was not possible to access this service. An ad blocker may be active. Consent to Google Analytics has been reset. If you would still like to help with the analysis, click
and please deactivate what prevents communication with Google's services or grant permission again in the main menu after deactivation.
Yes, I'm very happy to help
LLU: Error when fetching Glucose data
LLU: Patient data could not be fetched
LLU: The configured Patient-Id could not be found.
LLU: Upload of to Nightscout succeeded
LLU: No data available for upload
LLU: Access to LibreLink Up denied - Please check configuration

An error occurred while reading out the profiles. There may be too much data in the profile table (e.g. caused by iOS Loop). You can try to reduce the number of profile data records to be read in the settings.

text when data was received and is being prepared to be used in the report

The uploader "{$PH}" has created the data records.

The following uploaders have created the data records: {$PH}

trans-unit.source: The Nightscout server cannot be reached. Please check in the settings whether access has been configured correctly.
The data includes entries recorded using various devices. Please select the devices whose data should be used. If no devices are selected, the data is accumulated.
Creation will take longer for the following reasons:
Access to the Nightscout server is extremely slow. This could be due to an incorrect configuration on the server or a poor internet connection.
The data was loaded from the following server and the response took the specified time in total:
The data was loaded from the following servers and the response took the specified time in total:
This message can be deactivated in the Output Parameters dialogue.

trans-unit.note: text when pdf is being created

trans-unit.source: The PDF could not be displayed. Is a pop-up blocker active?
The URL has not been set yet
Do you really want to delete the user ?
The file was downloaded from Dropbox.
The file was not uploaded because the content has not changed.
The file has been uploaded to Dropbox.
Access to Dropbox could not be established any more.
Colors have been changed. Should these changes be discarded?

Connection to requires confirmation that Nightscout Reporter has the right to read and write data from . This confirmation is requested with special dialogues from . What needs to be confirmed there is beyond Nightscout Reporter's control. Should the confirmation process be started?

This website does not store any data on servers. The required data is fetched from the URL to the Nightscout instance and converted in a PDF. The data required for the website to work is stored in the browser's localStorage and is not transmitted to the server. If syncing with Dropbox is enabled, this data will also be stored in the application data on the connected account's Dropbox.
There is nothing more to say about it.
Since we have a DSGVO in Europe, the following text meets the rules for it. The following text is only available in German:
Do you want to unsync with Dropbox?

label for checkbox to hide nightscout in footer

trans-unit.source: Hide loop data (ignore the options marked in this way)

Correction for data changes in AAPS 3.0

Show warning if creation may take longer
Time format with 24 hours (otherwise AM / PM)

This determines how much the period of the PDF should be shifted in order to obtain comparative values.
