buttonlabel for copy of settings to beta version

trans-unit.source: Configuring LibreLinkUp allows Nightwatch to transmit the values received from the sensor via Abbott's Libre app to Nightscout. In order to do that, it is necessary for Nightscout Reporter to also know the API secret of the Nightscout instance, which is why you have to store it here. The other settings in this area are used to receive the data from LibreLinkUp.

The profile table should normally only contain data on the profiles used. iOS Loop uses this table to save its own settings and does this excessively at some users. Above a certain amount of data, the profile table can then no longer be queried correctly via the API. This is why there is this option of restricting the number of data records that are fetched from this table. This is necessary as long as iOS Loop or other uploaders fill this table incorrectly.
Maximum number of profile datasets:
This username / password combination makes it possible to receive data from LibreLinkUp.
This patient Id is used to obtain data from LibreLinkUp. It is only needed if there are multiple connections.
Here the region for LibreLinkUp must be specified.
The Access Token is only required if access in Nightscout was restricted via AUTH_DEFAULT_ROLES
The API secret only needs to be entered if the LibreLinkUp functionality is to be used.
This password makes it possible to write data to the Nightscout instance. Please do not pass it on to others!
The date of the first day with data
The date of the last complete day with data
Do you really want to delete the URL from the user?
A shortcut contains the period and the selected forms with the options set. When a shortcut is activated, the settings saved in it are loaded and activated.
Should the form selection be replaced with the current selection?
The shortcut named does not exist.
The theme @_themeName_@ already exists. Should it be overwritten?
The theme @_themeName_@ already exists and you cannot overwrite it. Please enter another name.
The name @_themeName_@ may not be used. Please enter another name.
The color theme database is not available.
Appears as the author of the color theme
When the theme @@ is loaded, the current changes will be lost. Should the theme still be loaded?
The color themes require authorization, which is currently not set correctly.

trans-unit.note: label of area for watch settings - automation

trans-unit.source: Call LibreLinkUp, if der Glucosevalue is outdated
Time after which the glucose value is interpreted as outdated
Timespan between periodic transfers of data from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout

trans-unit.note: title for nightscout reporter watch window

trans-unit.source: This will reset NightWatch to its default settings. Should this be done?

This page is used to generate PDF documents with the data stored at Nightscout. Therefore, it is necessary to be able to access this data, which is why a few settings must first be saved. As long as these are not available and valid, the site can do nothing for you.

The data you enter here will be stored in the localStorage of the browser. This contains website-related data that can only be read out from this website. No cookies are used and no data is stored on servers. Only a connection to the specified Nightscout instance is set up and the data available there is read out to create a PDF document. This can then be submitted to the diabetes counselor or other interested party.

When the settings are connected to the Google Account, Google's cookies are used and the data is no longer stored in the localStorage of the browser, but in the AppStorage on Google Drive. In this way you can manage the data centrally and have it available in any browser connected to the specified Google Account.
The website uses Javascript to carry out its tasks.

trans-unit.note: label for button to open settings on welcome screen
label for button to synchronize on welcome screen
label for button to open settings on welcome screen

trans-unit.source: Bolus Wizard entries were ignored when reading treatments. These are now also taken into account as long as there is no entry with the same timestampf that includes a meal bolus.
When evaluating the profile switches, an incorrect time zone setting was used, which could lead to strange basal rate lines. This has been corrected.

A help text can be displayed in the output parameters for the correction for AAPS 3.0. If I notice other points in Nightscout Reporter that need to be explained, I will also provide help texts for these.

There is now an option in the output parameters that determines whether times should be displayed in 24-hour or 12-hour format. Previously, this was determined based on the language. English (GB and US) had the 12-hour format, all others had the 24-hour format. If that is not correct, simply switch the option.

As I recently learned, there is also the possibility to further exacerbate the problem with CORS on the Nightscout server by filling the variable CORS_ALLOW_ORIGIN with allowed URLs. While CORS does not prevent access to the API from programs that do not run in the browser, this is another hurdle for programs like Nightscout Reporter to access the server. Therefore, the notification in the settings for connection problems has been expanded to indicate the possible presence of this variable on the server.
An info button has been added to the user list for the active user, with which you can change the information displayed below the username.
The progress bar for determining the time span of the data in the settings has been corrected.
In the menu, an external link to the corresponding Dropbox folder has been added next to the Dropbox synchronization menu item.

A note has been added to the error message regarding the Nightscout server not being accessible, as well as a button with which you can access the settings in order to correct any misconfiguration that may exist.
The error message when saving the settings if the Nightscout URL cannot be reached has been given a more distinctive colour.

In the user list, the list can be filtered in the browser by typing letters and numbers. A filter is then displayed above the list and shows how many users have the characters entered in their name or in an Url. In addition, the user list is filtered according to the input. The current user's selection can be moved through the list using the cursor keys. The selected user is activated with the Enter key.

For the daily graphic, there is now an option in the formparameters to display the duration of the notes as a bar. The corresponding bar is output below the bar that indicates the exercises. It is only issued if the corresponding note has a saved duration. Otherwise, the note is output as usual below the graphic.
Access to the Nightscout data is now monitored and evaluated more closely by Nightscout Reporter. If access is too slow, a message will be displayed indicating this fact.
There is a new option in the Output Parameters dialogue that allows you to toggle the display of the slow server connection message.
The timeout for accessing Nightscout data has been increased to 10 seconds in order to be able to generate PDFs even with a poor internet connection or questionable server configuration.
When entering the period, "Last 2 months" was added to the list of selectable periods.
The selection “Two months ago” was added to the historical data in the Output Parameters dialogue.

In the list of shortcuts there is now a link button for each shortcut. When clicked, the corresponding shortcut opens in a new browser window with the current user. This means you can copy the link to call up the shortcut directly from the address bar of the browser window and don't have to look for it in the documentation.
The shortcuts now also store the shift in the data period, so that you can save special shortcuts for historicized data.
The colours of the dialogue for transferring the current forms or the current period into a shortcut have been corrected.
In the output parameters you can define, if the HbA1C should be displayed in percent as before or in mmol/mol.
When selecting a language in which the texts were not fully translated, the missing texts were previously output in German. Missing texts are now output in English.

With this version it is possible to customize the colors in Nightscout Reporter. Activating the color change mode is done in the settings via a checkbox called “Adjust colors”. If this is activated, an icon with a palette will be displayed both next to it and in other places (e.g. in every dialog next to the close button), which gives you access to the colors for the corresponding area. The icon next to the checkbox in the settings shows the complete list of all colors when clicked. The colors are given names that make the most sense to enable identification. When you click on the buttons for the individual colors, a dialogue appears in which you can then set the color. This is adjusted in the application as the change is made, so you can immediately see what effect the color has. You can stop the color change at any time using the X at the top right of the dialogs and discard the previous changes.

From this version onwards, website usage data can be analyzed. That's why when you first access the page, a corresponding message is displayed that must be answered positively or negatively. The decision can be changed at any time in the main menu. If the analysis is refused, no data will be transmitted to Google Analytics. If the analysis is permitted, Google Analytics will be informed about this when the page is accessed. This helps the programmer make sensible decisions about language support and further development.
This resets NightWatch to its default settings after a security question.
The list of glucose sources can now also be output on the Analysis form. There is an option for this so you can turn it on and off.

On the form Daily Trend, you can now specify that only the glucose values should be displayed when the option for all values for the day is set. In this case, the glucose values for one day are displayed per page without any additional information.
The COB is now determined correctly in most cases even if the required carbohydrate absorption rate cannot be determined from the profile switches.
The star for users in the user list is now always visible. This makes it easier to change the staring.
The processing of data when creating PDFs has been revised. If there are many profiles, processing should now be much faster.

Processing of multiple sources of glucose data has been revised. When loading the data it is determined that there are multiple sources of glucose data, then before the PDF is created a dialogue will be displayed in which you can decide what to do with the data. You can select the glucose sources that should be displayed. The selection results in the output of the glucose data being restricted to this selection in several forms. In the daily graphic, this glucose data is displayed in slightly different colors with a corresponding legend. If no source is selected, then all glucose data will be output as before, along with an appropriate note at the top of each form.

It is now possible to transfer data from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout via NightWatch. To do this, you have to enter the relevant information in the settings in the section LibreLinkUp. It is now also necessary to enter Nightscout's API secret, as the data determined by LibreLinkUp must be saved in Nightscout.

There are new settings in NightWatch. There you can specify after how many minutes the displayed glucose value is considered outdated. So far it's been 14 minutes. If the glucose value is older than stated there, the background will be colorless. Under Automation you can specify how often the data is periodically transferred from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout. You can also specify that if the glucose value is out of date, the data should be automatically transferred from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout.

There is a new type of item in NightWatch. These can be placed like any other elements. But unlike the other elements, clicking on these executes an action and does not switch to edit mode. If these elements are crossed out, then the configuration for the functionality of these elements is missing. When you click on it, the corresponding configuration is shown.
New element LLU Exec in NightWatch. This element starts or stops the periodic transfer of glucose values from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout. The icons have the following meaning:
Currently no transfer of glucose values to Nightscout. Clicking on it starts the periodic transfer of data from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout.
The periodic transmission is running. Clicking on it ends this.

New element LLU Autoexec in NightWatch. This item starts or stops the automatic transfer of glucose values from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout if the glucose value is out of date. The icons have the following meaning:
If the glucose value is out of date, the glucose values are automatically transferred from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout.
The automatic transfer of glucose values from LibreLinkUp to Nightscout is disabled.
The origin of the glucose value can now also be output in the protocol form. Since there could be different sources for the glucose value, this information is sometimes quite helpful.

There is a new form called Period Evaluation. This form displays information over the entire selected time period. You can currently display the time in the target range, the daily total insulin and the daily carbohydrates.
The settings for NightWatch have been moved to the device settings so that NightWatch can be adapted to the respective environment on different devices.
In NightWatch you can now also change the glucose units in the watch settings.
In NightWatch the scale is now filled correctly even when mmol/L is selected.
A user can now be created in the user list using the button on the right below the list.
In NightWatch, the settings button now opens the user list. There is also now an owl menu in editing mode so you can switch the language.

The evaluation of the treatment data has been refined, so that SMB data can be recognized more flexibly. Something has probably changed in AAPS that has not yet been taken into account in Nightscout Reporter.
The display on mobile phones with the current Android version has been corrected so that the lower bar with the owl menu and the run button should always be visible.

In the list of users, users can now be given a star. These starred users are sorted to the top. In a list with many users, you can use this method to quickly find the ones you are currently dealing with.
If there are copied forms in a shortcut definition, these are now also output when the PDF is created via the call with the URL parameters.
The profile basal rate in the daily graph should now be displayed correctly again.
The setting for the maximum glucose value in graphs works as intended again.

After loading the data, the data is checked whether there are any datasets that have been uploaded from different devices. If this is the case, a dialogue is displayed in which the desired device for the evaluation must be selected. There is also the option "All", with which the values are displayed alltogether as before. If this selection is made, a warning will be displayed in the top right corner of every page, pointing out this circumstance.

A new shortcut parameter has been added that makes it possible to specify a device for which the analysis should take place. If none is specified, the selection "All" is made automatically. The Url with all parameters looks like this:
the name that was entered as a description for the shortcut.
the name of the user for whom the PDF is to be created. If this parameter is not given, the last opened user is used.
the number of months that the saved period is shifted to the past.

the name of the device for which the analysis should be done. If this parameter is given and no entry contains this text, then all entries are used. The same applies if this parameter is not available.

If the notes are entered in Hebrew, they are now also displayed correctly. There is the problem with multi-line comments that the order of the lines is reversed, which can be corrected by commas in the text. So instead of: זהו טקסט נפלא עם יותר מדי מילים it should be written like this: זה טקסט נפלא, עם יותר מדי מילים This then ensures that two lines appear in the correct order in the PDF. Nightscout Reporter does not yet have general support for fonts written from right to left. Since no one has so far shown up who would like something like this and would do the translation of the texts in Nightscout Reporter, this special solution for Hebrew notes will currently be the only one.

The start with shortcuts and NightWatch has been slightly modified. Instead of a # character, the call is now executed using the corresponding specification in the path. So instead of #watch the following is used: /watch With that, the use as installed apps is more stable on Windows and smartphones when you refresh the pages.

Fixed NightWatch display to gray out for values that are too far in the past. So you can see at a glance whether the value should be used to look at the current blood sugar level or not. In this case, "too far in the past" means longer than 14 minutes.

Since Czech was added as a new language (many thanks to Lukáš Trčka, who takes care of the translation), the language menu, which can be reached via the owl at the bottom left, has been redesigned with multiple columns.

The link to the facebook page has been removed from the menu because the facebook page is only for general information about a new version and you won't find any information there that isn't available in the program. In addition, the developer is unable to configure the Facebook apps to send him notifications that he has been contacted. Maybe Facebook is so bad in general that it's not possible without being bombarded with unimportant notifications. Because of this, in the past some users had to wait quite a long time for a message. Therefore the following has been added:

In the main menu the menuitem Feedback was added. This starts the program set for emails in the system and prepares an email to be sent to the developer. The mail can then be edited as desired to describe what needs to be known by the developer. The URL to the Nightscout instance is also copied to the mail, since this information is very useful in most cases to be able to reproduce the problem. However, this URL can also be deleted from the email before it is sent if it is not relevant for the reproducibility of the problem.
The call with a shortcut parameter could use an incorrect period. That has been fixed. The saved period is now evaluated correctly even when the PDFs are created automatically.

From this version there is again the possibility to synchronize the Nightscout Reporter settings so that you no longer have to enter them again in other browsers or on other devices. The synchronization currently only works via Dropbox. If you have an account there, you can connect to it. This is done in the main menu on the left side with the "Synchronize" item. When this is called, the Dropbox authentication workflow is started after a prompt. If this was successfully completed, the settings are searched for there when loading and saved there when saving. It is saved in the Apps/Nightscout Reporter directory. Nightscout Reporter only needs permission to write and read files in this directory. If you no longer want to be connected to Dropbox, you simply have to click on the menu item in the main menu again.
It is now possible to directly generate a PDF based on the settings in a shortcut by specifying this shortcut in the Url. The Url must be structured as follows:
Here x is the name that was entered as a label for the shortcut.
Specifying user is optional. u is the name of the user for whom the PDF is to be created. If this parameter is not given, the last opened user is used.
Specifying shift is also optional. s is the number of months that the saved period is shifted to the past.
The icon that opens the menu now shows the logo of the service used for synchronization when synchronization is active. If it's not active, you'll see the normal hamburger menu icon there.
The owl menu at the bottom left is now also available in the user list.

If the URL validation fails when saving a user, a dialogue is now displayed showing the reason for the failed save and giving the option to save anyway. In addition, an attempt is made to use the URL to determine which service is used for the Nightscout instance. If it is a known service (currently ns.10be.de and Google Cloud), a button is created in the footer of the dialogue that calls up further information or the service itself.
The progress bar for loading the data now also indicates when the output is for historical data.
The user list is now sorted alphabetically without case sensitivity.

If the profile table has been overloaded with too many entries by the uploader, it can happen that Nightscout Reporter cannot generate a report because this flood of data makes any meaningful evaluation impossible. That's why there is an option in the settings for some time to reduce the number of profile data sets when loading. This reduction is now done automatically when Nightscout Reporter realizes that it isn't getting any records or loading takes too long. The setting is retained for the time being, however, so that you can have some influence on the result if you want to. This does not solve the fundamental problem of uploaders running amok (e.g. Loop on iOS), but at least it now allows reports to be generated when the amount of data becomes critical.

The selection of the user has been changed. Previously, a list opened in which the users could be seen when you clicked on the user name in the title bar. Instead of the list, the content area is now used to display the users with tiles. The current user is marked like a selected form. The current user can be deleted with the trash can icon on the left and you can open the settings with the gear icon on the right. As before, any number of users can be created. When the list of users gets too big for the screen, it becomes scrollable. If the current user is clicked, it switches back to the list of forms.

Everything is new. This isn't clearly visible on the surface, but Nightscout Reporter's programming language was changed from Dart to Angular, which required a complete program rewrite. The functionality remained the same, it will just be much easier to keep up with the development of technology in the future.
All dialogues can now be moved by dragging the title bar.
The button for creating the PDFs now shows how many forms are selected.
The button for selecting the period will indicate if it is not until today but until yesterday or the previous weekend.
There is now a checkbox in the form parameters to switch all options on or off at once.
Night-Watch now also has displays for changes of catheter, reservoir, sensor and battery. Next to the corresponding symbol is displayed how long ago the corresponding change was made.

Hovering the mouse over a language in the language menu shows how far Nightscout Reporter has been translated into the respective language. Clicking on this progress bar will open the Crowdin page where you can translate the language if you have a Crowdin account. Everyone is free to do the translations there. The translations will then be visible in the next version in Nightscout Reporter. However, they are also updated from time to time between versions.

In the output parameters it is now possible to specify that the values are ignored for a certain time after a sensor change. This means that the values, which fluctuate greatly with many sensors in the initial period after a sensor change, can be removed from the reports.

The PDFs are now generated entirely in the user's browser. It is no longer necessary for the data created to be processed by the server. This means that significantly larger PDF files can be generated. This was attempted with 6 months of data resulting in a PDF with 3300 pages.
The input of the period for the PDFs has been moved from the title bar of the application to the dialogue for the output parameters.

Language switching has been moved from the dropdown menu on the left to the owl menu in the bottom left corner. If you click on that, you can select the color theme as usual and the available languages will appear in the form of the corresponding national flag.

The menu on the left does not close with every action. This was necessary with the old way of building the application, but there are other options in the new world. So you can click different options without having to open the menu every time.
The display of the current value in the title bar has been removed, since there is now Night-Watch, which can display this much better.
The ability to split the generated PDF into smaller portions has been removed as it no longer seems necessary with the current technology.
Fixed many issues with the appearance of certain areas of the application.
In Night-Watch there is now the possibility to enter the settings if you have activated the editor.
In Night-Watch you can now activate a night mode in which the background is black and the colours of the text represent the current value in relation to the target area.

The setting for adjusting BG_TARGET_BOTTOM and BG_TARGET_TOP is now independent of the "Adjust Glucose Values" selection. This allows you to toggle the option without having to reconfigure the target area on the server.

Night-Watch now also displays values if they have been saved multiple times in Nightscout by multiple uploaders within a short period of time. This should be avoided if possible, but now Night-Watch can also deal with it.

A new view called Night-Watch has been added. In this view, as in the clock display on the Nightscout page, you can see the current glucose value and other information that you can configure to a certain extent as you like it. Night-Watch is accessed via this URL: https://nightrep.zreptil.de/watch It can also be accessed via the main menu under the menu item Night-Watch, or by clicking on the current sugar value in Nightscout Reporter's title bar if you have activated it in the settings.

The configuration is done directly in the Night-Watch window by clicking on something. This sets the page to edit mode and the existing elements can be changed, moved, deleted or new elements can be added using the controls at the bottom of the window. With the save icon in the controls, the settings are saved and the edit mode is closed. It can also be closed by clicking the active item, but the changes will not be saved. After reloading the page you see the last view.

If Night-Watch is called without any configuration available, you can edit your settings via the well-known settings window. This happens when you install the page as a web app, since the browser memory, in which the configuration is stored, has usually not yet been filled.

Where a CGP can be created, there is now an option Lines around areas. This is switched on by default. When turned off, the healthy and current human stat ranges are no longer outlined with a line. This makes the graph look a little more pale, but you can examine the values on the axes more closely if you wish.
The adjustment of the glucose values is now saved in the settings. However, it can still be changed in the output parameters in order to be able to create a comparison without any detours.
The display of the factor on the PDF when a correction factor has been set has been changed to a percentage by which the sugar values have been increased or decreased.
The last version had changes in the code that weren't really thought through. I apologize for that. I removed these so that Nightscout Reporter offers the usual functionality again for all users.

The glucose values can now be corrected with a factor that results from the A1C value determined by the laboratory and calculated in the program. This factor affects all sensor values processed in Nightscout Reporter. The factor is specified in the output parameters. There it is activated and deactivated via the "Adjust glucose values" checkbox. When activated, two sliders appear. The upper one defines the calculated A1C, the lower one the A1C determined by the laboratory. If it is activated, the factor with which the glucose values were corrected is indicated on the top right of each PDF. This affects every PDF on which glucose values are processed.
The mean glucose value in healthy people in the CGM has been adjusted to the correct value of 90 mg/dl.
If the data for the daily steps taken is available in Nightscout, then these are displayed in the daily graph if the "Show Exercises" option is activated there.
In the options for the daily graphic there is now the option to set the upper value for the carbohydrates. This can improve the scaling with high COB values.

AAPS 3.0 changes some of the data structures and amounts of data that are stored. This causes problems in some places in Nightscout Reporter that cannot be generally solved. That is why there is now the option "Correction for data changes in AAPS 3.0" in the output parameters, with which certain problems can be corrected when creating the PDFs. These changes are marked here with FixAAPS30.

It is now possible to duplicate forms in the tile view in order to create different views of the same form at once. There is a copy icon on the bottom right of the tiles. When this is triggered, the current form is copied and inserted as a new tile behind the current tile. This can then be treated in the same way as any other tile. There is a trash can icon at the bottom right of this new tile. When this is triggered, the tile is removed. A maximum of 2 copies can be made of a form. The options for the forms, as well as the order, are saved as before. The copied tiles are therefore retained. The copied forms also appear in the list view. However, there is no possibility of copying or deleting them there. This must be done in the tile view.

In the profile and basal rate forms there is a new option "Use profile 'NR profile'". Normally, the profile to be used is determined automatically based on the specified time period. This option can be used to prevent this behavior and a profile with the name "NR Profil" is searched for. If this is found, it will be displayed. If it is not found, a text is shown that explains where this can be set.
The table in the glucose percentile diagram can now display two new columns. These include the average carbohydrates and units of insulin.
In the options of forms in which you can show and hide columns, it is now shown how many columns are still available.
The colors for the glucose areas are now displayed lighter where they are used as a background color with text to make them easier to read.
The temporary overrides of iLoop can now also be displayed in the daily graphics. The text of the reason is displayed. As before, this can also be displayed in the log for more detailed information.
The project was updated to Dart 2.13.4 and Angular 6.0.1.
Limit values were not consistently treated in the same way. The assignment of the values to the target areas should now be identical in the entire program.
There is a new form called "Distribution of glucose values". This shows the percentage distribution of the glucose values for the selected period.
In the daily statistics, the average values for some values are now also displayed in the totals line.

When defining the period, you can now specify up to which day the period should be determined. As before, the current day is preset. You can also set yesterday to have days with complete dates, or the last weekend if you are interested in complete weeks.

Dialogues and the display of the progress are now implemented a little different technically. Because of this, the application background is now shown darker in the cases and it is not possible to click on anything.
Fixed a bug that caused dialogues to be closed with Escape, leaving the application in an unusable state.
A bug has been fixed that prevented usage of the app when selecting the time period if you focused on an empty input field.
A bug has been fixed that caused the application to be in an undefined state when the last user was deleted.
The incorrect name for average carbohydrates per day in the daily statistics has been replaced by the correct name for average carbohydrates per meal.
The output of the target value and the blood values in the daily graphic has been corrected. There were problems when a different blood sugar unit than the one set on the server was used for output.

After I was asked again and again whether I could be donated, I decided to make such a possibility available. Nightscout Reporter is still completely free and will stay that way. If you still want to express your affection for the program, I don't want to stand in your way any longer. The donation button is not visible. But if you want to throw something in the {$START_BOLD_TEXT}hat{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}, you will find it :)

The Nightscout Reporter logo has been changed. It is still the well-known and popular owl, but it now wears a hat like the newspaper deliverers and sometimes also journalists in ancient films. The logo is only shown in the program and does not appear on the PDFs. There is still the normal Nightscout logo because it was placed there to refer to Nightscout itself.
An error in the output of the temporary goals in the daily graphic has been fixed.
Columns for TDD and carbohydrates can now be displayed in the daily statistics.
The URLs of the users are now sorted according to the end date.
The title of the Glucose Percentile Diagram is no longer displayed incorrectly in the form selection options when printing in portrait format.
There is a new option in the daily graph with which you can show and hide the target value.
An error has been corrected which resulted in missing data such as treatments no longer being able to create a PDF.

In the output parameters there is a checkbox with which you can ensure that all options that would indicate a loop are deactivated for this output. These are the options that are marked with a circle (= loop).
When Nightscout Reporter was started for the first time, it was displayed normally when the language changed. Now it stays on the welcome dialogue as intended.
The display of the images on tiles is now correctly preset in the settings as intended.

There are now small help buttons on the forms. In the list view they replace the icons for dragging the forms, in the tile view they are displayed on the top left of the tiles. The respective view can be selected in the hamburger menu. When you click on such a button, a text is displayed that describes what the corresponding form shows.

In the output parameters, you can now specify the unit in which the glucose values are to be shown. At the beginning this is determined from the data stored in Nightscout and pre-assigned accordingly. But it is also possible to change this unit or to have both units shown. If "both" is selected, then every form on which glucose information is available is shown first with mg/dL and then again with mmol/l. This unit is also saved in the shortcuts.
The profile basal rate in the daily profile form is now also displayed with bars.

iOS Loop misuses the profile table to save its own settings, which for users of this software meant that the profile table could not be loaded correctly. Therefore, in the settings there is now the option of restricting the number of data records that are loaded from the profile table.
Temporary overrides which are entered in the treatment data by iOSLoop are now also shown in the daily log.

In the daily profile you can now specify whether only the value, the percentage adjustment of the profile or both should be displayed. In addition, a line can be inserted that shows the value set in the basal profile at the respective point in time.

Profile changes are no longer displayed in the daily graphic if the profile has not changed. iOSLoop very often inserts new profiles into the nightscout data records that do not contain any changes because other configuration settings are also saved there.
An error when loading the selected forms has been fixed.
When syncing with Google Drive is canceled, the authorization is now reset properly. If you want to synchronize again afterwards, the authorizations are requested again.
A bug has been fixed that caused temporary targets to be displayed in the daily graph with a time shift.
Insulin deliveries are now also displayed on the Protocol page, e.g. if they were entered via xdrip.

There are now shortcuts with which you can save the current selection of forms, their parameters and the selected period. When activating a shortcut, everything is set back to what it was when the shortcut was saved.

With herokuapp and other providers of free database instances, the instance's storage space is limited, which is why it becomes full at some point. Then you can create a new instance, but Nightscout Reporter needs access to all instances for which you want to receive a PDF in order to be able to display it seamlessly every day. Therefore, multiple URLs can now be entered for the Nightscout instances. In addition, you have to enter which is the first and the last day with data. With this information, Nightscout Reporter can then seamlessly evaluate the required data across multiple instances.
If a value in the CGP exceeds the maximum value of the scale, the corresponding corner is marked with a yellow circle.
In addition to the URL input fields, there is a button on the Settings dialogue to open the URL in a new browser window.
The entry of the access key in the settings dialogue can now be made readable with a button next to the input field.

In the Settings dialogue there is now the possibility to export and import the settings. When exporting, a file is written with the general settings; when importing, such a file is read in again. This allows you to manually synchronize the settings across different browsers even without Google Drive access.

In the daily log there is now the possibility to have duplicate records marked. Nightscout Reporter filters them out, but it can show how often a particular record was found in the data. You can also specify that it should only output data records that exist more than once. This way you can find out possible differences between Nightscout Reporter and other reporting tools.
The CGP is now generated correctly even with extreme values.
The scale labels have been corrected in the CGP.

In the dialogue of the output parameters there is now the possibility to always generate the CGP with the standard target area. This option is initially activated because the CGP is a standardized form that is often used for comparison purposes. But you can turn it off for your own purposes. This setting is retained.
The last profile change was sometimes ignored when determining the profile. That is now fixed.

In the dialogue of the Output Parameters, the switch "for comparison purposes" was added in the top right. If this is activated, the standard target area is used everywhere. Internally, this is also used for other adjustments. This option is designed so that you can compare your printouts with other diabetics. This is useful, for example, for submission to doctors and diabetes consultants.

You can now specify in the output parameters whether the newest day is always displayed first. This has an impact on the daily graph, the daily statistics and the weekly graph. The corresponding option has been removed from the form options.

The setting for opening the PDF in the same window, downloading the PDF and hiding text about Nightscout in the PDF has been moved from the settings to the output parameters. This allows you to quickly set and change that for each output.
The title above the table of glucose percentile diagram has been corrected.
The legend of the daily graphic now includes the entry for blood values.
The microboli from the Minimed 600 Uploader have been removed from the output, because they are just temporary basal rates.
A possible crash in the output of the CGP in the daily graphic has been fixed.

In the dialogue with the output parameters, an option was added to specify the precision of the output of basal information. This is usually determined from the information on the basal rate in the profiles. This is still the case when the first entry in the list is selected. Otherwise, all basal information is output with the precision selected for this option.
The precision of ISF in profile was corrected.
In the log, the information that sets a temporary target of 0 U for 0 minutes is output as "Cancel temp target".
Various calculations were corrected in the CGP, which were mainly shown in differences in ToR and average values.
The legend of the daily graphic has been expanded to include the entry for exercises.
In the daily graphic in the german version "Training" was replaced by "Bewegung" since this matches the wording in AAPS better.
The color for exercises in the daily graphic changed.
The analysis values were not determined correctly. This has been corrected and the statistical data evaluated over the period should now be correct.
When the treatment data is loaded, duplicate data records are filtered out.
The calculated IE for carbohydrates in the daily graph were partly determined with wrong factors. The bug has been fixed.

In the percentile diagram there is a new option with which the basalrate can be displayed below the diagram. Since the diagram normally spans a longer period, the basalrate that was active at the beginning of the period is displayed.
Fixed a bug that sometimes prevented the parameters for the tiles from being called in the tile view.

There is a new PDF called Daily Trend. This shows the values of a day together with the trend on the hour and the basal rate set in the profile. This is a good overview for basal rate tests to see where something needs to be adjusted.

There is a new option in the daily graph to prevent the rounding of the insulin values to the maximum precision in the profile. This makes sense when either there is no profile or when values are entered with greater precision than in the profile.

In the daily graph you can now display the IOB (Insulin On Board) and COB (Carbs On Board). The IOB is shown at the top, where the bolus is shown, the COB at the bottom, where the carbohydrates are shown.
Nightscout Reporter can now also be used in Portuguese.

There is a new PDF called Dayhours. This shows the average values of a day in every hourly interval and fills the cells backgroundcolor according to the glucose value. This gives you a good overview of the distribution of values in the selected period.

In the Glucose Percentile Diagram you can now set a maximum for the scaling. If it is set to "Automatic", the maximum is determined as before. For any other value, the upper limit for the diagram is set to this value. This makes it easier to compare two diagrams with different upper limits.

Before a PDF is created, a dialogue is displayed in which you can enter parameters for all PDFs created. You can set the target area to the standard area that doctors like to see. This has an impact on all representations of the target area, as well as on the distribution of the values inside and outside the target area. You can also set the maximum value for glucose in graphics there. This value is used in the daily graphics, the percentile diagram and the weekly graphics. If it is set to "Automatic", the maximum value is determined from the existing data as before. You can also specify here whether you want to generate the current period or a comparison period. This is useful to show the doctor a comparison of past and now values.
The buttons for creating previous periods have been removed. This can now be set in the new PDF dialogue.
If there are empty columns on the profile page, this no longer leads to an empty page.
The values CV and ToR in the CGP are correctly output for day and week graphics in the legend and in the graphic.
The images on the tiles are now labeled in the respective language.
The values in the CGP are now also correctly displayed for mmol data.
The glycemic variability is now correctly displayed in the CGP even with daily and weekly graphics.
Blood values should now also be displayed correctly in the daily graph for mmol data.
There is a new option on the page "Hourly Statistics" to also show columns with 10% and 90%.
The validity is now displayed with the time on the "Profile" page.
The entries in the log for temporary targets are now displayed correctly even with mmol data.
The heading above the middle column in the daily profile has been corrected.
The bars in the analysis are now scaled correctly.
Most of the columns on the page "Hourly Statistics" are left blank if there is no data.

In the daily graphics, there is the option to suppress HTML notes. Some uploaders write complete HTML pages in the notes, which is extremely difficult to render in the PDF. That's why you can hide them by setting this option.

The Glucose Percentile Graph has been expanded to include the Hourly Statistics table. This tabulates the values of the period for each hour of the day. You can either create just the graphic, just the table or both together.
Slovak is now also available In the language selection.

There is a new PDF page for the daily profiles. It contains a table showing the actual basal rate for the day, including all temporary adjustments. I needed that for debugging, but maybe the some users find it interesting too. The profile displayed there corresponds to the day profile on the page Daily Graphics. Loops can produce many pages, as the basalrate is usually adjusted every few minutes. Therefore, depending on the amount of data, the table is displayed in a maximum of three columns to reduce the number of pages.
Delayed boli are now displayed in the daily graph.
The daily graph now shows the duration of the basal rate at 0%.

The UI can now assume different representations. These show themselves at the moment by different colours and an adapted icon in the Browser tab and with the loading of the side. This does not affect the generated PDF files. It's the preparation for a partially customizable surface. The theme of the UI is set by default by the system, which currently means that a Christmas theme will be displayed in December. But this can be changed by clicking on the icon, which can be seen at the bottom left. When clicking the icon, an area with the available themes is displayed to the right of the icon. The first icon (the little wizard) means that the theme is determined by the system. At the moment this means the Christmas presentation in December. However, there may be other criteria in the future that will be used to adjust the theme. However, the direct definition of a theme with one of the other icons always takes precedence over the system logic.
With the basalrate and the profile, there is now an option to have only the last one printed in the corresponding period. This reduces the number of pages with frequent profile changes.
In the analysis, an area can now be displayed, showing the number of hypos in the selected period and the time of the last hypo.
In the settings dialogue, the lines with the user details and the URL were exchanged for a more meaningful administration.
The page numbers on the tiles have been moved further to the bottom so they are always easy to read.
The profiles for the period were partially incorrectly identified. That should be fixed.
The determination of the effective daily basal rate has been restructured and should now give more accurate values.
The error with the multiplication of the carbohydrates with the repeated output of the PDFs was corrected.
The problem that certain days could not be created has been fixed.
An error in number formatting has been fixed.
The temporary basal rate at the beginning of the day has been set incorrectly if it was set in the previous day. This has been fixed.
The protocol can now also show battery changes of the pump.
The single page CGP can now also be output in landscape format.
The accumulation of the values in the analysis has been corrected.

In the tile view, the parameters of all selected pages can be set together in a list. For this purpose, there is an additional button in the title area of the parameter list next to the close button, with which you can switch between the two options.

The settings for downloading the PDF, opening the PDF in the same window, and the maximum size of the PDFs were excluded from syncing with Google Drive because they are specific to the browser or device you are using. They are still saved, but they are not synchronized between different browsers.
The preview images on the tiles will partially adjust depending on the options selected (for example, choosing CGP for day graphics).
The CGP now displays the current values in the legend.

It is now possible to save the settings to Google Drive. This has the advantage that you have the settings not only in the current browser, but in any browser, which is connected to your Google account. The settings are still stored in the browser. When connected to Google Drive, they will also be stored on Google Drive. When loading the page, it checks if synchronization is desired. If that's the case then the data will be downloaded from Google Drive. If the downloaded data is newer than the data in the browser, it will be used. Once the data is saved, syncing will save that data with the current timestamp to Google Drive. The synchronization is activated and deactivated in the menu on the left side. It can also be activated when calling the page fpr the first time in a new browser directly in the welcome screen. Nightscout Reporter only requires permission to save and load your own app data and does not require access to other data on Google Drive.

When selecting the daily basal rate, it is now possible to specify in the options of the daily graph that the name of the profile that was active at the beginning of the day is displayed. This will then be displayed as a profile change at 0 am.

Images can now be displayed on tiles instead of names. The pictures then show the approximate appearance of the corresponding page. They do not correspond to the actual data, but are just a visual representation that may make it easier for some users to quickly select the pages they want. The activation of the images can be done using the settings dialogue.
Fixed wrong data display in the daily statistics when a day has too little data.
On the profile and basal rate pages, the title bar now again shows the date where this profile starts.
Temporary profile changes are now recognized and displayed correctly in the daily graphics.

The "Comprehensive Glucose Pentagon" has been added as a separate PDF and as an additional page to the daily and weekly chart. It is a representation of five measures, with the help of which the quality of the therapy can be determined and compared with others. On the printouts, a reference is output to the underlying paper.

In the daily graph, there is an option to display the calculated IE for ingested carbohydrates. The value displayed below the carbs is the bolus that should be delivered for that amount of carbohydrate at that time. This value may be lower than the actual value delivered, because IOB and other factors are taken into account for insulin delivery.
In the daily graph, the temporary targets are now also taken into account when displaying the target value.
There is a new option in the analysis to fine-tune the standard range. Very high values and very low values are displayed with this option.
Nightscout Reporter can now be used in Japanese.

It is now possible to display the buttons for PDF selection as tiles. The option can be found in the menu on the left. In the tile view, the buttons are distributed over the available area and are thus easier to hit on small devices. In addition, you normally see all available PDFs at a glance and do not have to scroll. The activated tiles indicate at which point in the PDF the corresponding pages are created and how many pages the corresponding tile creates. The number of pages can be determined correctly for most tiles, but for some this is not possible without data insight (for example, profiles and protocol). In this case, either no page number or a minimum number of pages is shown. Once the PDF is created, the correct numbers will be displayed. The sortorder of the tiles can be changed by dragging it to where you want it. After clicking the icon in the upper right corner, the parameters for the corresponding PDF can be set.
The profile now shows the total basal rate and the average ICR and ISF per hour.

Options for the PDFs that have a unique relationship to a running loop are now displayed in blue. This makes it easy to create PDFs where you can not easily deduce that there is a loop running. All you have to do is to uncheck the blue options.

The basalrate profiles for the day are now also determined based on the treatment data. Profile changes are displayed in the daily graph and should also show a correct basal rate adjustment from the moment of change.
The pages profile and basalrate for a profile that was temporarily active during one day now only show this timespan.
The Buttons for past periods will not be displayed if no period or PDF is selected.

Some of the options for the PDFs have been arranged hierarchically. There is no point in having the SMB values placed in the daily graph at the curve if the SMB values are not displayed at all. Therefore, options that depend on another option are only displayed if the corresponding option is selected. This unfortunately also changes the storage of options, which is why the current selection of options for some PDFs changed. These options have to be set again.
The selection of the period and the user has been moved to the title bar.
The determination of the unit (mg/dl or mmol/l) is now handled more flexibly, so that even spaces in the corresponding setting no longer lead to a misinterpretation.
A bug has been fixed that caused the daily graphics to overwrite texts in the legend.
The calculation of the PDF sizes has been corrected, so that fewer PDFs are created when they are divided due to the size.
The same database is used to calculate the analysis, daily statistics and daily graphs so that the values are the same on all PDFs.
Blood values which are entered by Loop on the iPhone are now also recognized.

There is now the ability to generate PDFs of past periods without having to adjust the period. there are two buttons for earlier periods above the button for creating PDF which generate the PDFs. The lower of the two buttons generates the previous period, the upper one the penultimate period. The buttons show the start date and the end date. If the period "last 2 weeks" is selected, then the lower button creates the period from two weeks starting four weeks ago and the upper button the period from two weeks starting six weeks ago. In this way, it is easy to generate comparison reports to detect the development of the values. The words "Historical 1" or "Historical 2" are placed above the period on the pages for these printouts in the header. So you can distinguish the data from each other when comparing the sheets.
The partially misallocated limits for the areas (low, normal, high) have been corrected.
Increased the width of column for ICR on the profilepage.
If the basalrate has more than 2 decimals the insulin values are smaller on the daily graphics.
Removed the obsolete option for the decimals of the basalrate from the daily graphics.
A link to the Facebook page of Nightscout Reporter was added to the menu.
The mixture of two pages on one PDF page, which sometimes occurred has been fixed.

There is a new option in the settings to display the last glucose value stored in Nightscout in the title bar. If this option is enabled, the current value, the age of the value, the trend arrow and the difference to the previous value is displayed at the right side of the title bar. This display is updated every minute as long as your browser window has the input focus. If it hasn't the focus, the update is stopped and the value is hidden to avoid unnecessary burden on system resources.
In the daily graphis there is an option, that adds the exercise data to the graphic. It will be displayed at the bottom of the graphic right above the glucosetable.
The columns on the page have been corrected to accommodate longer time names (e.g. in Spanish).
In daily graphics and weekly graphics there is now the possibility to place 1, 2, 4, 8 or 16 images on a page.
The division into multiple PDF files works better now.
If the period is empty, the button for the selection is marked clearly and in the dialogue to choose an indication appears in the title bar.

It is now possible to set the days of the week that should be used in the period. When selecting a period the corresponding days are set with the buttons below the month. On the PDFs, the periods are shown with the days of the week that are used, if at least one is missing.

The scales on the graphics have been updated. Now they show whole numbers for mmol/L and the units have been removed. These are shown at the bottom of the graphics. This includes the daily graphics, weekly graphics and the glucose percentile chart.

If the generated PDF is too large, it is divided on several PDF files now. In this case, it will not directly open, but there will be shown a list of numbered buttons. These buttons open the corresponding PDF and get a checkmark, indicating that it has been opened. This should make it easier to open the PDFs, because usually the current browserwindow is moved to the background when a new window is opened.
In the settings there is a slider that defines how large the resulting PDF files may be. When a blank PDF is created, then this slider should be moved further to the left, to reduce the file size.
The display of SMB can now be hidden in daily graphics.
The order of the forms can now be changed. Simply click on the handle on the left side of the button for the form, hold it and drag it to the place where it should be printed.
The analysis page now also shows GVI and PGS.
The standard deviation of the values in the target area can now be displayed on the analysis page instead of the number of values.
Now also the standard deviation of all values of the period will be shown on the analysis page.

There is an option in the daily graphics there that makes it possible to distinguish the different types of bolus. If this option is set, a bolus that was given for a meal is marked with a different color than the bolus given as correction. In the legend there are also separate values for meal-bolus, correction-bolus and SMB.
Most of Nightscout Reporter is now translated to Spanish and Polish. Corresponding buttons have been added to the main menu. Thanks to the diligent translators :).
The control for the definition of the period has been adjusted so that it is displayed correctly on narrow display.
The accuracy of the insulin dosage is determined from the profile. The value with the highest precision defines how many decimalplaces are used for display of basalvalues.
Data from different uploaders is now better interpreted.
Data which was marked as sync by xDrip will be ignored in the caluclations.
The colours for dialogues and scrollbars have been adjusted.
The calculation of actual basal rate was corrected.
The profile page has been adapted so that entries for 24 hours fit on one page.
The menu links to Nightscout and the reports of Nightscout now also work correctly when a usertoken was provided.
It is now possible to scroll the main page in Firefox, if it is longer than the browser window.
Blood values are displayed correctly now in mmol/L in the graphics.
Standard deviation is now also shown correctly when using mmol/L.
Wrong alignment of buttons on mainpage has been fixed.
There is now also the possibility to use Nightscout Reporter in European English. The difference to American English currently exists only in the date format (gb: dd/MM/yyyy, us: MM/dd/yyyy).
The legend below the daily graph shows the sum of carbohydrates for the day.
Reservoir changes are now also shown in the daily graph.

The daily chart now shows the estimated A1C and the percentage of bolus insulin and basal insulin for the day. These values are displayed within the legend, which is why it must be enabled for the values to appear.
DIA on the profile page is now displayed with two decimal places.
There is now an option for the daily graphics to toggle the accumulation of close values.
The carbohydrate information on the daily graph is now output without the suffix KH.
The bars for the bolus insulin in the daily graph are now scaled according to the maximum bolus insulin at that day.
In the analysis the percentages for the target areas can be shown with decimal places. This reduces the difference to 100% if you sum it up. The remainder is because of rounding differences.

The daily graphic now sums up insulin values and carbohydrate values when there are several values within an hour. The bars are still drawn individually for each value. In this way there should be no overlapping output of the values anymore. The summarized values are displayed in square brackets to indicate that values have been summed up here.
Fixed the bug in the profile that caused the ISF and target range values to be incorrectly converted.
Fixed the erroneous placement of the blood values in the daily graph when using mmol/L.
The profile now uses the correct units (mg/dL or mmol/l).
New option in the profile to combine consecutive times with the same values into a single entry.
If more times were recorded in a profile than fit on one page, they were overlaying the content of the next page. Now a new page is created as needed.
In the daily statistics and in the daily graphics, the days of the week are now displayed with the day of the week.
Added a new PDF for a weekly graphics where the week's glucose curves are shown all at once.
New daily graph parameter that determines whether or not to draw the lines for the notes under the graph up to the glucose curve.
In the analysis, the information for material (catheter, sensor, ampoule) can be displayed with decimal places.
The calculation of the daily insulin now also takes the SMB into account.
The daily chart now also displays blood glucose values. They are displayed as red squares and the associated values ​​in the table below the graphic are also displayed in red.
The microboli of the Minimed 600 Uploader are now also identified and output in the analysis, if they exist.
There is an option in the settings to download the PDF instead of having it displayed directly in the browser. This is needed for browsers like Edge.
Carbohydrate corrections are now displayed in the daily graph.

The selection of the period is now more flexible. The selection is done in a dialogue that takes the language into account. Selecting the default ranges (today, last week, etc.) sets the current date as the basis for the range at the next call. If the range is set directly in the calendar, then it will be applied the next time as defined. By default, the first day of the week is now a Monday. However, this can be set to your own preference by clicking on the day of the week in the title bar of the month. The date fields are entered in the form that corresponds to the language (day.month.year for German, month/day / year for English).
The calendar control can no longer select a date after the current day.
The calendar control now displays the month of the corresponding date when one of the fields From or To receives the focus.
If there are gaps in the entries of 15 minutes or more, there will also be a gap in the daily chart.

The positioning of the notes in the daily chart has been corrected so that they are closer to the time. The strokes were shortened so that they go only to the bottom of the graph and not through the table of values.
The own limits on the analysis page in mmol/L are now calculated correctly.
Fixed a bug that caused the last days of certain months not to be displayed in the calendar control.
An error has probably been fixed that causes some profiles to miss the value for DIA incorrectly.
In the calendar control, a defined period (today, last week, etc.) is now correctly based on the current day.
Fixed incorrect output of blood glucose levels in the daily graph.
The profile PDF is now created in landscape format so that profiles with many entries for the parameters can also be displayed.
If special characters are present in the data (eg smileys in the notes), this caused a crash during the PDF creation. This has been fixed by removing these special characters from the output.
Daily graphic parameters for displaying notes
Daily graphic parameters for displaying notes
Added daily graphic parameters for reverse sorting. The daily graphics are created starting with the highest date.
The daily graphics now displays a chart with half-hourly glucose values. This can be switched off via a parameter.
In the daily statistics, the column Coefficient of variation has been added (CV).
SMBs are now also displayed in the daily graphics if the option for displaying insulin has been activated. You can specify whether the SMBs are displayed on the glucose curve or at the target value.
The calculation of the totals row on the Daily Statistics page has been corrected.
added additional information about the PDFs and in the UI
Sums for bolus insulin, basal rate for the day, and basalrate from the profile added to the daily chart

Some forms can now be configured with parameters; click on the arrow on the right side of the formbutton and make the appropriate settings in the opened area; the arrow will not appear until the form has been marked for printout
Added number of sensors to analysis
The possibility for beta functions has been removed; the beta version is now available at:
Title information for date ranges on the PDFs are unified
Fixed a crash that occurred when no matching profile could be found for a given time
Users can specify a user token to connect to protected nightscout instances
Carbohydrates and bolus insulin are now displayed in the daily graphs
Added column A1C to daily statistics
Added missing totals in daily statistics
Column width of the information in the analysis increased
The icons on some buttons were too close to the text
Temporary basal rates with absolute values ​​are displayed correctly
You can now create multiple users. This is useful for analyzing multiple nightscout instances (e.g. for doctors, caregivers or the developer of this software)
User data is now stored encrypted in the browser
The analysis page has been redesigned and now displays headings above the areas
If the thresholds in Nightscout (BG_TARGET_BOTTOM and BG_TARGET_TOP) are equal to 70 and 180, then the area for the default targets will be hidden on the analysis page
The daily statistics now display mmol/l values ​​correctly
The values ​​for the default target range on the analysis page are now calculated correctly
Numbers and dates in the PDF are formatted according to the selected language
When loading the data, the corresponding date format is used for display of progress
Faulty values ​​are no longer considered in the evaluation of the graphics; these are recognized by the value "NONE" in the data field "direction"
Additional data is used for the calculation of carbohydrates
Fixed various crashes when reading data
The ability to display the URL in the title bar has been removed since the current user or his URL is now displayed directly
Added legend for catheter and sensor changes to the daily chart.
Order of PDF pages changed - Percentile Diagram now comes after analysis.
Data for the glucose values ​​with incorrect date format are read out correctly.
High basal rates are now better represented.
Added this page. It is displayed each time Nightscout Reporter starts, if it has not been displayed in the current version. In addition, it can be called up again in the burgermenu.
Close button added in the message area.
Errors are better intercepted and replaced with more meaningful text.
Clicking on the message area no longer closes it.
Name, birthday, insulin and the start date of diabetes can now be left blank without any negative impact on the presentation in the PDF.
Error message when loading profiles without start date removed.
If no data is available, blank pages will be generated with an appropriate hint.
The glucose graph of the daily graphs has been freed from missing data.
The basal rate PDF was incorrect if there was not a value for each hour.
Should the colour changes be discarded?
With the button to the bottom right an imagecan be loaded. From this you canselect a color.
The file has bytes, but must not have more than bytes.

trans-unit.note: subtitle for datepicker dialog when period empty
trans-unit.source: Please check activation of the days of the week below the month
The start date is not correct
The end date is not correct
Define as first day of week
The values for BG_TARGET_BOTTOM and BG_TARGET_TOP have been divided by the factor {$PH}

trans-unit.note: bolus calculated by the bolus wizard

trans-unit.source: There is no data for the printout

Source: Vigersky, R. A., Shin, J., Jiang, B., Siegmund, T., McMahon, C., & Thomas, A. (2018). The Comprehensive Glucose Pentagon: A Glucose-Centric Composite Metric for Assessing Glycemic Control in Persons With Diabetes. Journal of Diabetes Science and Technology, 12(1), 114–123. (https://doi.org/10.1177/1932296817718561)
Insulin Carb Ratio (ICR) X g Carbs for 1 U
All sensory glucose readings have been reduced by {$PH}%
All sensory glucose readings have been increased by {$PH}%
Insulin Sensitivity Factors (ISF) 1 IU reduces BG by X {$PH}
Deselect a column@nl@to be able to activate another one

The profile with the name "{$PH}" could not be found. This must be set up in the profile editor on the Nightscout page. A profile must be set up there with the name "{$PH_1}" in order to be able to generate this form. The link below opens the profile editor. Under certain circumstances, the authentication must then be carried out at the very bottom of the page in order to be able to change the values.
No profiles could be loaded. It may be that the profile table contains too many entries. In this case, it can help if the "Maximum number of profile data records" is reduced in the settings.

This form shows the evaluation of the values ​​of the selected Period. The average consumption of materials is calculated and displayed. This form contains most of the information that diabetologists would like to know.
The A1C is calculated from the available data and normally deviates not insignificantly from the actually measured value. The value that is determined from the blood sample shows the actual binding of glucose in the blood. Since this depends on additional factors and not only on the measurement data used here, there are differences to the calculated value. Especially when the measured values ​​are not blood sugar but tissue sugar, as used by CGM systems.
Nevertheless, this value is a rough guide to the quality of the Glucose setting and in the form determined by the laboratory is often used by diabetologists as a guide value, which is why it is displayed here. But it is issued in a weaker font so that its dubious nature can also be recognized.

This form shows the basal rate set in the profile in graphic form. Usually all basal rates for the selected period are displayed. If the basal rate has changed in the period, a new page is created.
However, there is an option that only outputs the last basal rate of the period.

This form displays the Comprehensive Glucose Pentagon, which represents the quality of the glucose control in a readily understood manner. For the selected period it shows how long the average glucose value was outside the target range during the day, how high the intensity of the hyperglycemia and hypoglycemia was, how high the mean value was and how high the variability of the values was.
This graphic can also be output at @05@ and @08@.
This form shows an overview for one day. Here the daily graph, the basal rate, the basal rate adjustments, Insulin On Board and Carbs On Board displayed.

This form shows the trend in glucose levels over the day. The Trend column always shows the percentage by which the value has changed from one full hour to the next. This trend is very helpful if you want to see in a basal rate test how the glucose value is developing based on the basal rate alone. A column for bolus values and carbohydrates can also be displayed. However, these should of course be empty in a basal rate test. Any existing loop must also be switched off during the test. It's all about the diabetic and his basal rate.
A column with the basal rate is also displayed if the option "Show all values for a day" is not checked. If the option has been marked, then there is no space (and also the sense) to display it.
Show all values for the day

trans-unit.note: The informational text on the page Daytrend for the basalrate
trans-unit.source: The basal rate has been valid since {time} and does not include any temporary changes.

This form shows the the glucose curve for one day. One page is generated per day in the selected period. There are many options that can be used to customize this form. The options that indicate a loop are marked in a different color so that they can be identified very easy. The options COB and IOB sometimes slow down the output considerably, which is why you should only use them if you are really interested in it.
The basal rate can be displayed below the graphic. A running loop will raise and lower this over and over again. This is why you can display both the actual basal rate and the basal rate set in the profile. For the basal rate there are the forms @09@, @11@ and @02@, on which you can analyze it more precisely. You can also have the @10@ generated for the day. This is then printed on a new page.
This form is one of the most page-intensive forms in Nightscout Reporter. This is why there is the option of displaying several daily graphics on one page. Of course, legibility suffers from this, but it is very useful for an overview of the progress.
Draw lines from notes to the curve
Show the duration of the disabled basal rate
Round insulin to maximum precision in profile

This form shows an overview of the hours of the days of the selected period. The displayed values are the median values of the values measured within the corresponding hour. They are colored based on the selected target area. The start hour can be set in the form options. The date column is always to the left of midnight and shows where a new day begins.

This form shows the data in tabular form. It can consist of very many pages depending on the options you choose. It is especially useful to find certain data. For example, it can be used to determine when the catheter was changed, how many data records were recognized as duplicate or where notes were recorded.
temp. Override for {$PH} min, Reason: {$PH_1}, Targetrange: {$PH_2}, Scale: {$PH_3}%

This form shows the actual basal rate that has run during the day, taking into account any temporary basal rate adjustments. The basal rate stored in the profile can also be displayed. The basal rate can be displayed as a value, as a percentage change in relation to the profile basal rate, or both. The total column shows the basal rate delivered up to the corresponding time. It is also possible to display the time with seconds. This can be used to mathematically check the displayed values.
If the basal rate is displayed from the profile, the maximum for the display of the bars is determined using the maximum value of the profile basal rate. As a result, the bars are extended beyond the column for values above 100% of the maximum value of the profile basal rate. But there is an option to cut off these bars and to show them as arrows.
Show values above the maximum as arrows

This form shows the statistical values for the days of the selected period. A line is generated for each day. The columns can be partially configured. The estimated A1C is also output here. As in the @01@ form, this has very little informative value, which is why it is shown here also with a weaker font.
This form shows the distribution of the glucose values in the selected period.

This form shows how the glucose values are distributed over the day in the selected period. This distribution can be output graphically and in tabular form.
In the graphic, the areas for certain deviations are color-coded. The line shows the median value. You can look up the values in the table. If the basal rate is also displayed, then this is the basal rate that was active at the beginning of the selected period.

This form shows the profile. Usually all profiles of the selected period are shown. If the profile has changed during this period, a new sheet is created.
However, there is an option that only outputs the last profile of the period. There is also an option to combine lines with same values. This leads to a shorter profile if several times in succession contain the same values.
Combine entries with the same values
This form shows analysis over the entire period.

This form shows the glucose curve over a week. The period is divided into weekly segments and each week is displayed on a separate page. The weeks are color-coded so that you can easily distinguish them. In addition, the @10@ can be generated for the respective week.
